comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Mrs. Blanche A. W. Heye was involved in a newsy Long Island divorce case in summer 1913. Her ex-husband was George G. Heye, a banker in Manhattan. Her request for $78,000/year alimony was considered scandalously extravagant, and the judge who heard the petition took the opportunity to scold her on that point. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/7248848

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: George Gustav Heye, a German immigrant, made a fortune in petroleum. His collection of Native American artifacts was the largest in the world. The Heye Foundation collection became the Museum of the American Indian, which is now a branch of the Smithsonial Institution. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Gustav_Heye
